item.title: My Voice My Choice: when Law 194 is not enough
item.description:
Promotional image of the campaign - by My Voice My Choice, fair use

Guaranteeing free and safe access to abortion in all EU member states, while providing economic support to women in need, is the goal of the “My Voice My Choice” campaign. On the occasion of the International Safe Abortion Day, the initiative has gained unprecedented support both in Italy and across Europe.

item.title: Press freedom, does it really exist in the West?
item.description:
Protesters of the 'Free Assange' movement outside the High Court in London, UK - by Alisdare Hickson, CC BY-SA 4.0

Journalism is a complex and varied field, in which not all professionals operate with the same integrity. There are journalists who simply report official narratives and others who, with courage and determination, dig beneath the surface to uncover hidden truths. The latter can be considered the true heroes of our time, dedicated to exposing propaganda and bringing uncomfortable facts to light.

item.title: Debaptism: an act of freedom and self-determination
item.description:
Activists of the UAAR at the 2014 Commemoration of the Capture of Rome - by Sergio D'Afflitto, CC BY-SA 4.0

In recent years, the topic of baptism and its subsequent religious imposition has sparked an increasingly heated debate in contemporary society. More and more people are choosing to “debaptize” themselves, a symbolic act of liberation from perceived constraints often dictated by a social and cultural context influenced by religion, particularly Catholicism. This phenomenon reflects the desire to affirm one’s autonomy and reject a religious identity imposed from birth.

item.title: Copyright is a tool that limits freedom
item.description:
The Pirate Bay, a famous torrent search engine - by Broblike, CC BY-SA 4.0

In an era where information and culture are more accessible than ever, the effectiveness and fairness of copyright is being questioned. The reality is that copyright limits the sharing of knowledge and cultures, causing harm to all of humanity, especially to those living in poorer countries who do not have access to the desired materials. It is time to reflect on how this regulation, originally created to protect the author, is actually crystallizing works and ideas, thus denying many the opportunity to enjoy and contribute to a shared cultural heritage.
